data.enText: the act of making parts of sth, groups of people, etc. work together in an efficient and organized way
a need for greater coordination between departments
data.chText: 各部门间加强配合的必要

data.enText: a lack of coordination in conservation policy
a pamphlet produced by the government in coordination with (= working together with) the Sports Council
data.chText: 政府在体委的配合下发行的小册子

data.enText: advice on colour coordination (= choosing colours that look nice together, for example in clothes or furniture)
the ability to control your movements well
You need good hand-eye coordination to play ball games.
data.chText: 玩球类游戏，手和眼的动作要协调好。

tr: the regulation of diverse elements into an integrated and harmonious operation
being of coordinate importance, rank, or degree
the skillful and effective interaction of movements
the grammatical relation of two constituents having the same grammatical form

example.ex: ...the lack of co-ordination between the civilian and military authorities.
example.tran: 老百姓和军事当局之间缺乏协调

defx.def: If you do something in co-ordination with someone else, you both organize your activities so that you work together efficiently.

example.ex: ...operating either in coordination with federal troops or alone.
example.tran: 要么和联邦军队协作，要么独自行动

value.def: Co-ordination means organizing the activities of two or more groups so that they work together efficiently and know what the others are doing.

example.tran: 身体笨拙而且缺乏协调能力

example.ex: To improve hand-eye co-ordination, practise throwing and catching balls.
example.tran: 要想提高手眼协调能力，就练习投球和接球。

value.def: Co-ordination is the ability to use the different parts of your body together efficiently.

trans: 协调功能；协调式功能；协调函数
